ratings.rComments: Pretty easy class. He is a way chill teacher. I would definitely recommend this if you are looking for something with an easy A.

Steve is a great guy, though I did not learn much in ADV199. The field trip is fun, though we had no grade in the class until the last day of class. Definitely recommend taking a class with him at some point.

Honestly one of the coolest professors you will ever have the chance of meeting. He loves what he does and he loves making lectures fun and interesting. A lot of the test questions are about lecture so it's a good idea to go to class. I never missed a class of his because I loved it so much.

Awesome teacher. Makes lectures fun and it is clear that he wants the students to do well. This class is an easy A if you study for tests and I really enjoyed learning about advertising because of him.

One of my favorite classes. Go to lecture! 80% of the test comes from his lecture examples and definitions. You only have 4 tests (no final) and a project. The tests are very straightforward (he gives very detailed review guides and notes can be found online). He gives a fair amount of extra credit as well. Great class and professor!
This class was great. Easy and fun to go to lecture. Steve is a great professor and offers a lot of extra credit. Tells you everything that's on the test.

He knows his stuff. He's an awesome teacher and makes lectures interesting. I would recommend scheduling office hours with him though, he's a pretty busy guy. Take notes in class and graze over the textbook and you'll be fine.

Steve is an awesome guy and an awesome teacher! He knows so much about the industry and makes lecture interesting. Make sure you take notes in lecture and read the textbook for the tests but don't stress too much because there are extra credit opportunities.
Very interesting course about advertising in general, all the different agencies, and careers in the field. Exams were pretty easy and he's a cool guy.

This class is very easy.  Everything is very straightforward. But this professor is a very bad. Tests are poorly written. What a disgrace for an instructor who does not know how to write a proper exam. Also take very good notes in lecture since he will not post lecture notes online. He only post lecture outlines, which do not cover everything.

Super nice professor and all of the lectures are really entertaining. half of the test is over stuff talked about in class and the other half is from the book, so don't try to get by in this class without either.  He also offers lots of extra credit and take advantage of as much of it as you can, because the small points really add up.

Not an easy A. Loved attending classes he showed great clips, and examples. The test/exams were pretty tricky if you didn't read the book or attend class. But there is tons of extra credit just in case you fail the tests. The assignments/ projects were fairly easy though.

Steve is an awesome teacher. He is very chill and interesting. There are only four tests and a project so in order to do well you must study a lot for the tests. Even though the material is common sense, he finds a way to make the tests difficult.
He's amazing. So funny, really laid back. Never keeps you the whole time. If there's nothing to do in class, he will just cancel it. He's awesome!!!!!

Honestly I hated going to class just cause it was three hours long, but he took that into consideration and would give us breaks. Class mostly consisted of him showing us YouTube clips of commercials, You always had something fun to show friends but you have to really read the textbook to pass the exams. He's pretty cool but all over the place.

Def came out of the class a lot more aware of how advertising shapes my everyday judgment.Exams came with a study guide given usually a week  in advance.Assignments were more toward the end of the semester but overall didn't ask for anything unreasonable as they just required you to think a bit outside the box/creatively. Recommend for advanced hrs

Professor Hall class was interesting. I wouldn't say this is the easiest class i ever taken, because i actually had to spent time reading the text books and notes. However, overall the class was easy, in order to get an A in this class, all you need to do is to study carefully and find out every answer on the study guide, and you will get an A.

I didn't like this guy at all. He wasn't helpful, and in lecture all he does is talk about himself and all the places he's traveled. Plus he name drops a lot. He tends to just skim the important material. You have to really pay attention in lecture and take thorough notes. However, it's not too hard to get a good grade.

Steve knows a lot about the advertising industry, but he rambles. Most of the time you just YouTube ads. The tests are kind of hard because his lecture notes are just examples without real definitions. He is very well connected though, and he's pretty funny.
Super easy class and Steve is awesome! Such a foodie and has traveled everywhere. Very interesting even if you're not an Advertising major!
Professor Hal keeps class interesting with real-world, current examples. He seems knowledgeable about the topic. Also, he is very approachable if you are ever in need of assistance.

Very easy class! 50% of the tests are based on in class material, 50% is based on the book, but he provides study guides of EXACTLY what will be on the test. I studied the night before every test and did the easy homework assignments and got an A. He is a really nice guy too and there is usually a decent amount of extra credit.

Take this class!!! It's actually really easy. Some people might not agree, but honestly if you come to lecture (which is really interesting) and just take good notes then you are set for an A+! It is really easy, I didn't spend too much time for this class and did well. And Steve is really nice and knows alot!

Awesome class. Steve knows exactly what he is talking about every class.  I'm already missing going to it.  Very easy exams if you have the book and the lecture notes, and so many extra credit opportunities it is insane.

CLass was definitely NOT as easy as before or as easy as  people said. And even Steve said there were very few Extra Credit opportunities this semester.  Attendance is mandatory otherwise you won t be able to answer the test questions.
Awesome professor. He's full of stories and knows just about everyone in the industry. Easy A for the class.

Easiest A ever as the only grade for the class is a portfolio you turn in at the end and a class trip to Chicago to tour Ad agencies. Steve is a great guy who is very knowledgeable about the industry. Most of the classes involve a guest speaker from the industry coming to the class (some were very interesting). Take class for easy A or to network

he is knowledgeable about adv and very passionate about teaching. this class is not as easy as before but it's still easy with  plenty of extra credit opportunities. the tests are straightforward and easy if you memorize all the notes and assigned readings. the class covers interesting topics and shows tons of cool adv clips.

It wasn't quite as easy as everyone said it would be (they changed the curriculum to include 5 tests and 3 hw assignments), but it was still VERY easy. Steve is a great guy, and you can tell he is passionate about what he teaches. I learned a lot. Also, you get to watch a million youtube videos. I actually looked forward to going to class.

Although he isnt as easy as he used to be, its still really easy to get an A. I studied the day before all of our tests and did fine. When you add in all the extra credit he gives you its a pretty easy class. The study guide that he gives you for each test tells you exactly what you need to know. 5 tests total and 3 hw.
Easiest A ever. The whole semester, I learned literally nothing. Basically, you only have to do a portfolio which takes 1 hour and you get an A.
veeeery easy class.
This class is the mother of all jokes. I can truly say I got a little stupider.

This was a really easy class. You don't even have to go if you don't want to. Next semester he is not teaching ADV 300 - there will be a different professor. Hall is very nice and I am sure any class you take will be easy and enjoyable.

Steve is nice but his class was pretty useless. All we did was listen to speakers and didn't really learn much from the class. It's a 3 hour class but it rarely lasts even 1 hour. The entire grade is your final portfolio, which is a binder of everything you did in the class. He's pretty confusing, changes his mind a lot, and drops names constantly.

easy class, but his lecturing skills are terrible. he rambles about his personal experiences, and breezes past slides with legitimate information on them. the book is VERY expensive, which he admits to, but try and share a copy because you don't use it often enough for it to be worth the cost. also doesn't use a microphone in a class of 300+
SOOOO EASY!!!! guaranteed A+, get out of class early, don't even need to go! so much exta credit and no hw/exams! take it for an easy elective... but it is hard to get into!
Easiest class on campus.  I went to about seven lectures all semester and got an A+.
If you don't get an A in this class, there is something wrong with you.

Amazing. No quizzes, no tests. Just a few assignments. You don't have to attend class for 3 weeks at a time if you want. But his lectures can actually be interesting and some classes you just watch good commercials.

Easy A.  You don't have to go to class but there are assignments about in class things so take the class with friends and occaisonally go together. I love its upper level credit.  You do nothing.  He is a jerk when you actually speak to him in person.  Whatever... you get an A.

im still trying to figure out how this class is allowed on campus. its is ridiculously EASY. i think it was instituted to boost GPAs. if u get the chance to take it DO NOT PASS IT UP! projects are easy except the last ones require some effort. attendance is not necessary unless u have an in class assignment or something due (he tells u in advance)

TAKE THIS CLASS!! it is so easy.  when reading these comments, disregard those saying this class is annoying or hard, because they are probably quite dumb, you'd have to be to think this class is challenging.  I did not attend EVER, and yet i got a 100 percent.take the class.if you don't, you will regert it.  OH, AND HE DOES LOOK LIKE A GRAPE!

this man teaches one of the most pointless classes ever invented for credit. no final exam, no tests. people take notes but this is a waste of time, as is attending. i did not even know steve hall's name until the end of the semester since i did not go to this class ever. things you should know: he is loud, and resembles a grape.
best. class. ever. no tests, slides are online but it's pretty necessary to go to class because he uses examples in class not on the slides, then uses them on assignments.  so much fun!

This is probably the easiest class on campus.  Also, it's pretty interesting.  He usually lets out earlier than the alotted time.  Theres about 5 assignments, no tests, and a couple in class activities.  Automatic A.

Very easy class, no exams just projects which can be time consuming but are not difficult. Lots of work left till the very end of the semester. Interesting guy to listen to during lectures even though its not necessary to go.

Two huge projects left at the end of the semester so plan ahead to have room in your schedule for that.  Take this class with a friend and  you can switch off who goes to which class becuase all you need is the notes randomly here and there. Grades depend on who your TA is...overall easy A, no final exam.

This class is so easy.  It is interesting, but all of it is just common sense.  Out of a class of 750 about 200 came to each lecture.  Left 2 projects worth 25% of your grade EACH due the last 3 weeks of class.  Also, lots of hot girls take this class if you're into that.
easy as hell, didn't learn anything.

Basically, this man is paid to breathe and drop names of all the people he knows in the industry for a few hours a week. A tool outside of the classroom as well. Truly a waste of time. Unhappily, a required course for adv majors. An easy A though. And a good guy to know when you start job hunting.

If you want to literally do nothing and get an A+, take this class.  If you're not a total moron, and you think college is about actually learning something valuable, don't take this class.  Everyone gets an A.

He is the most unhelpful instructor I have encountered on the campus in 3 years of college. He didn't release assignments until weeks after he said he would, and left 2 huge projects for the last week of the semester. Grading is random and the TAs don't have a clue about anything. Not worth the stress, and he and the TAs never reply to their email.
Worthless class. You will honestly learn nothing. There is no final just projects.   if you don't get an A you are just dumb.

Steve Hall is the worst and the least organized professor I have ever stumbled upon. The class is a joke and the TAs dont have a clue as to what is going on. Lecture is pointless because there are no tests or final.  Projects are unclear and worthless. I learned and did completely nothing and got an A.  Going to class is a waste of time.

He is a complete moron. He promised to put up assignments so that we would have time to do them, and then he never posted them until (literally) weeks later. Grading was random and capricious, and it took FOREVER to get things graded and graded posted. I truly dispise him,&te never responds to email

This class is one of the easiest classes I have ever had in college. No tests, just take home quizzes. A couple of easy BS papers are assigned as well. You do not need the book or even go to class. If you have a firend who does go, just use their quiz answers. Tons of Extra Credit available. This class is pointless but an easy A.
best teacher ever.  he's very funny and made this one of my favorite classes

Irritating is the best word to describe this class.  The lectures suck, the take home quizzes are really specific about things no one could possibly remember.  I really can't describe it any other way except that it is constantly irritating.
Easiest class I have EVER taken- take it if you want to get an A+ without even trying or going to class
Not as easy as everyone says but he is really cool.  Lectures are actually fun.
SO easy
awesome professor..interesting lectures.easy class.
what a joke, the lowest grade on the final project was a 590 of 600 possible and its a 300+ person class
one of my favorite classes I have taken at U of I.
I heard starting SP 04 the class is going to be slightly harder than before. And by that I mean he might actually make us think more... ha..
Best Class Ever
Easy.. no tests.. only assignments & online quizzes you can take as many times as you want.  Fun guy... lectures got somewhat boring, but he had some fun stories.
Easy A!  As long as you memorize his review sheet, there should be no reason why you don't get an A.
You may think he is nice, but just wait until you actually have to talk to him
Could care less about the class or your performance, but still easy
Easiest A I ever received, and Steve's stories rock!!
